events.name: Mobile VR: Just a Daydream away?
events.description:
MEETUP OVERVIEW Mobile VR is typically the first VR experience for most people thanks to high penetration of smartphones worldwide and the lower cost of hardware compared to the PC tethered VR counterpart. On this topic, we are happy to announce that for our next meetup we have four distinguished guests -- including YouTube's Global VR Evangelist Scott Broock -- who are playing a role in delivering new mobile VR experiences. They will share recent developments and insights in mobile VR, and details of their respective company's advancements in this space. Evening Rundown 5.00pm - Introduction / AsiaVR Updates from Co-Founder Don Anderson A quick recap of the AsiaVR Association and introduction of our MC for the night, Ashima Thomas, CEO of Warrior9. 5:05pm - Scott Broock, Global VR Evangelist, YouTube Scott Broock is YouTube's Global VR Evangelist. Prior to YouTube, Scott was the VP of Content and Deal Development at Cinematic VR startup Jaunt, where he partnered with key decision makers in Hollywood, The Recording Industry, Television and Digital Media. Scott will give a perspective on the state of VR through a US-based / YouTube lens. 5:30pm - Shane Gavin, Creative Director, Booster Pack Shane Gavin is a VR enthusiast and Game Developer with over 15 years’ experience on a wide range of Platforms working for Pandemic Studios/EA, Lucas Arts and most recently co-founded Booster Pack. Currently focused on experimenting with mobile VR and how we can craft experiences that will earn money in that future B to C space, rather than the B to E(nthusiast) space.  Shane will be talking about integration experiments with VadR (an advertising platform), implementation in Unity and the emerging “Best Practices” to increase your click thru rates. 6:00pm - Willy Wong, Co-Founder and Producer, Kaiju Den Studios Prior to the formation of Kaiju Den, Willy spent decade of his career as an animator. He worked on a wide range of projects spanning from MMORPG, Triple A to Mobile Games. Willy will discuss how Kaiju Den pushes the boundary of game immersion and experience through Virtual Reality. He will also share details of the work and inspiration behind Kaiju Den Studios' upcoming Mobile VR title, Lunar Eclipse. 6:30pm - Marc Hardy, Co-Founder and CEO, RunSocial Marc will share his company's experience in developing highly interactive multiplayer mixed-reality video content, and explain how the tech has been used for social and fitness applications, including by NASA's astronauts in the International Space Station. 7:00pm - Final Announcements, Demos and Networking We will be hosting a number of demos focusing on Mobile VR applications. We encourage you to stick around to test out what the future has in store. 8:00pm - End of Meetup 


THIS IS A FREE EVENT (Live Broadcast viewable in our facebook group) The AsiaVR Association is a non-profit association focused on promoting dialogue, debate, collaboration and investment in this rapidly evolving area of technology innovation. Our members come from a wide variety of disciplines, including user interface and application development through to VR documentary filmmaking and branded content creation. We welcome anyone interested in contributing to the discussion, or just wanting to come up to speed on this exciting new area, to join us. Do join our discussion in our Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/asiavr/ 


In partnership with NUS Enterprise @ Blk71 (venue sponsor)  Let us know if you would like to subscribe to the NUS Enterprise Plug-In newsletter to receive updates about entrepreneur related events. For more information: http://www2.blk71.com/
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951
events.group_name: AsiaVR Association - Singapore Virtual Reality Meetup Group

events.name: SIA App Challenge - IBM Workshop
events.description: Digital Transformation on the digital Innovation Platform Bluemix. In this digital era, uberization is making many big organizations start learning from new digital startups bringing digital innovation as part of the company’s roadmap. Big data, Cloud, Mobile, IoT, Cognitive and UXUI are buzz words for organizations including airlines to rethink and outthink. Bluemix enables everyone from individual developers to large enterprise teams to rapidly build and deploy new applications, embrace continuous delivery and extend existing IT investments with cloud integration services. With Bluemix, developers have access to a broad portfolio of capabilities -- IBM, open source, and 3rd party services - across DevOps, Big Data, Mobile, IoT, Blockchain, Analytics, Cognitive and Security on Cloud with a click of a button. IBM Bluemix Services that will be discussed: - Watson (Cognitive) - Internet of Things(IoT) - Data Analytics - Mobile - Blockchain Come and learn, share and prepare for SIA App Challenge. Selected participants from the workshop will be eligible for further mentorship which includes design thinking and quick prototyping.
events.location: Marina Bay Financial Tower 2, Level 42, 10 Marina Boulevard - 018983, Singapore

events.name: One night with Scala!
events.description: Hi,thanks a lot for coming last night. We hope you have enjoyed our night class. We are glad to announce that Mark Brewer will be our next speaker. Mark is the CEO of LightBend, the company behind the Scala language, the Play framework, Akka... Mark will be there to answer all the questions you have (and the ones you didn't even know you have!). We will also take this opportunity to make an announcement about our next step: Singapore's first Java conference! == Schedule 7.30 - 7.45 : Michael Isvy: Java Conference announcement 7.45 - 8.45 : Mark Brewer We will be in Paypal at the 7th floor. The 7th-floor conference room is smaller than the usual one, we only have 60 seats available. We look forward to seeing you guys there!
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: Design Innovation Dialogue
events.description: The Design Innovation Singapore community will come together every month to chat, socialise and have a dialogue about topics such as Human-centred Design, Design Thinking in different industries, Creativity in Teams and Innovation Practices in Organisations. We welcome all creatives, innovators, startup entrepreneurs, technologists, consultants, bankers, educators, policy makers and everyone interested in Design Innovation in Singapore. Come and meet an interdisciplinary group, make the right connections and build the Design Innovation community Singapore. See you from 7 pm.

events.name: Building An Effective Landing Page
events.description:
An effective landing page is critical for digital marketing. Once you've done all work to get visitors to your website, the next important step is to convert them into leads for your business. In this class, you will learn the essentials of an effective landing page to acquire users. Get ready to build your own in 30 minutes! [ Who should join ] 。Marketers 。Aspiring entrepreneurs 。Non-technical startup founders [ What you will learn ] 。Learn the essentials of an effective landing page 。Build your own landing page [ Workshop details ] 。Date: 15 Sep 。Time: 7.30 - 9.30pm 。Venue: The Co. @ 99 Duxton Road 。Price: SGD 15 (Fully refundable at the end of the workshop) *Admittance to the workshop is strictly for people who paid for the event only. Full refund will be made at the end of the workshop. The amount will be credited back to the credit card and will be shown in your bank account statement in 5-10 working days. * * Please bring a laptop (either MacBook or non-Mac). [ Instructor ] Benjamin Kwang Full Stack Developer, DBS Innovation Group Over 13 years of software development experience, Benjamin is now work in DBS Innovation Group, devoted to supporting startups and startup ecosystem. 


*** This is a PAID event. Kindly register and pay directly http://bit.ly/2ciJEjK
